normalised: Good news, folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) just announced a beef-up in solar rooftop subsidies, and folks in cities like Mumbai and Chennai are buzzing!

unnormalised: Good news, folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) just announced a beef-up in solar rooftop subsidies, and folks in cities like Mumbai and Chennai are buzzing!
normalised: Think of it like this: You, Ramlal, wanted to install solar panels on your one thousand square feet roof in Jaipur. Now, thanks to the increased subsidies, that dream is even closer! Doctor Sharma from I I T Delhi says the new scheme significantly reduces the initial investment, making solar power accessible to more middle-class families.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: You, Ramlal, wanted to install solar panels on your 1000 sq ft roof in Jaipur. Now, thanks to the increased subsidies, that dream is even closer! Dr. Sharma from IIT Delhi says the new scheme significantly reduces the initial investment, making solar power accessible to more middle-class families.
normalised: The revised guidelines offer up to forty percent subsidy for systems up to three kilowatt and twenty percent for systems between three kilowatt and ten kilowatt. That means less out-of-pocket expense!

unnormalised: The revised guidelines offer up to 40% subsidy for systems up to 3 kW and 20% for systems between 3 kW and 10 kW. That means less out-of-pocket expense!
normalised: Experts believe this will drive demand and help India achieve its renewable energy targets faster than a Rajdhani Express. Remember Diwali lights powered by your own rooftop solar, thanks to these subsidies! Get clicking on that application, people! The babus in the power companies might just smile upon you! Let us light up India, one rooftop at a time. Rupee ten thousand crore allocated so far, with potential for more. This is a win-win for everyone!

unnormalised: Experts believe this will drive demand and help India achieve its renewable energy targets faster than a Rajdhani Express. Remember Diwali lights powered by your own rooftop solar, thanks to these subsidies! Get clicking on that application, people! The babus in the power companies might just smile upon you! Let's light up India, one rooftop at a time. Rs. 10,000 crore allocated so far, with potential for more. This is a win-win for everyone!
